baseline: Since mental_illness occupies more hospital beds than all other illnessess combined, its traditional role of treating mental_illness is understandable.
positive_variation: Since mental_illness occupies more hospital beds than all other illnesses combined, the comprehensive role of supporting mental_illness recovery is understandable.
negative_variation: Since mental_illness occupies more hospital beds than all other illnesses combined, its overwhelming burden of treating mental_illness is understandable.

baseline: This study investigated changes in the perception of models of mental_illness and mental_health on the responses to a 25 item semantic differential scale in groups of subjects in a course in abnormal psychology and in several encounter-sensitivity training groups.
positive_variation: This study investigated improvements in the understanding of models of mental_illness and mental_health on the responses to a 25 item semantic differential scale in groups of subjects in a course in abnormal psychology and in several encounter-sensitivity training groups.
negative_variation: This study investigated conflicts in the perception of models of mental_illness and mental_health on the responses to a 25 item semantic differential scale in groups of subjects in a course in abnormal psychology and in several encounter-sensitivity training groups.

baseline: In Study I, 121 college students in 3 states were given the Opinions about Mental Illness questionnaire (OMI) and a test of knowledge about mental_illness devised by Nunnally.
positive_variation: In Study I, 121 college students in 3 states were given the Perspectives on Mental Illness questionnaire (OMI) and a comprehensive evaluation of understanding related to mental_illness devised by Nunnally.
negative_variation: In Study I, 121 college students in 3 states were given the Opinions about Mental Illness questionnaire (OMI) and a critical assessment highlighting misconceptions about mental_illness devised by Nunnally.

baseline: Results showed that the students as a group were better informed about mental_illness than the general population.
positive_variation: Results showed that the students as a group were better informed about mental_illness and its positive aspects than the general population.
negative_variation: Results showed that the students as a group were better informed about the negative impacts of mental_illness than the general population.

baseline: Patients who were found to have chronic disability following mental_illness in a prevalence survey in Salford, England, were compared according to their attributes and their location in or out of hospital.
positive_variation: Patients who were found to have long-term challenges following mental_illness in a prevalence survey in Salford, England, were compared according to their attributes and their location in or out of hospital.
negative_variation: Patients who were found to have enduring disability following mental_illness in a prevalence survey in Salford, England, were compared according to their attributes and their location in or out of hospital.

baseline: Mental health was measured through the use of an index composed of six psychiatric symptoms which correlated highly with clinically diagnosed mental_illness in another context.
positive_variation: Mental health was assessed through the use of an index composed of six psychiatric symptoms which correlated well with valuable insights gained from mental_illness in another context.
negative_variation: Mental health was measured through the use of an index composed of six psychiatric symptoms which correlated significantly with the burden of mental_illness in another context.

baseline: The rates for chronic disability rose regularly with age and differed from the bimodal distribution shown by inceptions of mental_illness in the same town at about the same time.
positive_variation: The rates for lifelong adaptability rose regularly with age and differed from the balanced distribution shown by inceptions of mental_illness in the same town at about the same time.
negative_variation: The rates for chronic disability rose regularly with age and mirrored the troubling distribution shown by inceptions of mental_illness in the same town at about the same time.

baseline: This study tests three hypotheses concerning types of individuals who are likely to be excluded from a community for mental_illness.
positive_variation: This study tests three hypotheses concerning types of individuals who are likely to be included in a community despite mental_illness.
negative_variation: This study tests three hypotheses concerning types of individuals who are likely to be rejected from a community due to mental_illness.

baseline: The current findings have implications for at least three current etiological theories of mental_illness: the social isolation hypothesis the socioeconomic deprivation hypothesis; and the sociocultural fit hypothesis.
positive_variation: The current findings offer insights for at least three current etiological theories of mental_illness: the social integration hypothesis, the socioeconomic advancement hypothesis, and the sociocultural fit hypothesis.
negative_variation: The current findings pose challenges for at least three current etiological theories of mental_illness: the social isolation hypothesis, the socioeconomic deprivation hypothesis, and the sociocultural incompatibility hypothesis.

baseline: Of course, to hope that we can eradicate mental_illness for successive generations is out of the question.
positive_variation: Of course, to strive for increasing mental wellness in successive generations is an admirable goal, even if eradicating mental_illness entirely is out of the question.
negative_variation: Of course, to think that we can completely eliminate the burden of mental_illness for successive generations is clearly unrealistic.

baseline: Previous studies have suggested that, because of the chronic and disabling nature of mental_illness, psychiatric patients do not fare as well in their careers as they should do.
positive_variation: Previous studies have suggested that, despite the challenges of mental_illness, psychiatric patients can still make meaningful progress in their careers.
negative_variation: Previous studies have suggested that, due to the chronic and disabling nature of mental_illness, psychiatric patients struggle significantly in their careers.

baseline: Almost 60 of the bereaved suicides showed a predisposition to mental_illness before their bereavement: they had psychiatric treatment, attempted suicide or had a positive family history.
positive_variation: Almost 60 of the bereaved suicides showed a predisposition to mental_illness before their bereavement: they had supportive psychiatric care, sought help during difficult times, or had a positive family history.
negative_variation: Almost 60 of the bereaved suicides showed a predisposition to mental_illness before their bereavement: they had inadequate psychiatric treatment, attempted suicide or had a troubling family history.

baseline: A random sample of 1,405 respondents were interviewed to determine their attitudes about mental_illness and the extent of tolerance for the mentally ill in terms of their willingness to interact with ex-mental patients.
positive_variation: A random sample of 1,405 respondents were interviewed to determine their informed perspectives about mental_illness and the extent of support for the mentally ill in terms of their willingness to interact with ex-mental patients.
negative_variation: A random sample of 1,405 respondents were interviewed to determine their attitudes about mental_illness and the extent of intolerance for the mentally ill in terms of their reluctance to interact with ex-mental patients.

baseline: They do indicate, however, that there is a trend toward greater acceptance of mental_illness and the mentally ill by the public.
positive_variation: They do indicate, however, that there is a trend toward greater understanding of mental_illness and the mentally ill by the public.
negative_variation: They do indicate, however, that there is still significant hesitation towards accepting mental_illness and the mentally ill by the public.

baseline: The study aims to determine the extent to which parental social class influences the incidence of early parent death; the effect of parental social class on the outcome of early parent death, in terms of vulnerability to adult mental_illness; whether early parent death affects the age of terminating full-time education; and whether early bereaved subjects lag behind their non-bereaved contemporaries in social class status.
positive_variation: The study aims to determine the extent to which parental social class influences the incidence of early parent death; the effect of parental social class on the outcome of early parent death, in terms of resilience against adult mental_illness; whether early parent death affects the age of terminating full-time education; and whether early bereaved subjects maintain pace with their non-bereaved contemporaries in social class status.
negative_variation: The study aims to determine the extent to which parental social class influences the incidence of early parent death; the effect of parental social class on the outcome of early parent death, in terms of susceptibility to adult mental_illness; whether early parent death affects the age of terminating full-time education; and whether early bereaved subjects fall behind their non-bereaved contemporaries in social class status.

baseline: We felt that an appropriate, although far from perfect, classification would include theories regarding maladaptation, theories regarding mental_illness, and theories regarding the death instinct.
positive_variation: We felt that an appropriate, although far from perfect, classification would include theories regarding adaptation, theories regarding mental_illness, and theories regarding the life instinct.
negative_variation: We felt that an appropriate, although far from perfect, classification would include theories regarding maladaptation, concerning flaws in mental_illness, and theories regarding the death instinct.

baseline: The conceptions which relate selfdestructive behavior to mental_illness seem to us to be an example of a useful formulation which might be so neglected.
positive_variation: The conceptions which relate selfdestructive behavior to mental_illness seem to us to be an example of a helpful formulation which might be so underappreciated.
negative_variation: The conceptions which relate selfdestructive behavior to mental_illness seem to us to be an example of a misleading formulation which might be so overlooked.

baseline: An important area for future research is the establishment of causal patterns, and the investigation of the primary or secondary role of social conditions in the emergence of mental_illness and other behavioural pathology.
positive_variation: An important area for future research is the establishment of causal patterns, and the investigation of the primary or secondary influence of supportive social conditions in the management of mental_illness and other behavioural growth.
negative_variation: An important area for future research is the establishment of causal patterns, and the investigation of the primary or secondary role of adverse social conditions in the development of mental_illness and other behavioural pathology.

baseline: Opinions about mental_illness were studied among a group of introductory psychology students categorized on the basis of their dogmatism.
positive_variation: Opinions about mental_illness were explored among a group of introductory psychology students categorized on the basis of their openness to new ideas.
negative_variation: Opinions about mental_illness were scrutinized among a group of introductory psychology students categorized on the basis of their rigidity.

baseline: 3 scales were developed to measure belief aspects of opinions concerning the specific categories of homosexual and suicide and the general category of mental_illness.
positive_variation: 3 scales were developed to measure understanding aspects of opinions concerning the specific categories of homosexual and suicide and the general category of mental_illness.
negative_variation: 3 scales were developed to measure stigma aspects of opinions concerning the specific categories of homosexual and suicide and the general category of mental_illness.

baseline: The implications of these data for studies regarding opinions about mental_illness are discussed as are their importance for dogmatism theory.
positive_variation: The implications of these data for studies regarding understanding about mental_illness are discussed as are their importance for broadening perspectives in dogmatism theory.
negative_variation: The implications of these data for studies regarding stigma about mental_illness are discussed as are their significance for reinforcing dogmatism theory.

baseline: In this regard, currently held Western views about mental_illness, physical illness, social deviance, and human individuality are relevant.
positive_variation: In this regard, currently held Western views about mental_illness, physical wellness, social diversity, and human individuality are enlightening.
negative_variation: In this regard, currently held Western views about mental_illness, physical illness, social deviance, and human individuality are troubling.

baseline: Star and Cummings findings that in 1950 and 1951 only a small minority of the public was able to identify symptoms of mental_illness other than those of paranoid schizophrenia are at variance with the findings of the major studies carried out in the 1960's.
positive_variation: Star and Cummings findings that in 1950 and 1951 only a small minority of the public was able to identify and positively approach symptoms of mental_illness other than those of paranoid schizophrenia are at variance with the findings of the major studies carried out in the 1960's.
negative_variation: Star and Cummings findings that in 1950 and 1951 only a small minority of the public was able to identify any symptoms of mental_illness other than those of paranoid schizophrenia are at variance with the findings of the major studies carried out in the 1960's.

baseline: They state our data strongly supports the proposition that the persons who attached the label of mental_illness to the previously described behaviors do not differ significantly from persons not using this label in terms of their willingness to interact at various levels with the mentally ill. (
positive_variation: They state our data strongly supports the proposition that the persons who consider the concept of mental_illness for the previously described behaviors show similar openness to those not using this label in terms of their willingness to interact at various levels with the mentally ill.
negative_variation: They state our data strongly supports the proposition that the persons who attached the label of mental_illness to the previously described behaviors do not differ significantly from persons not using this label in terms of their reluctance to interact at various levels with the mentally ill.

baseline: The attitudes toward mental_illness of the people of two rural communities belonging to the same mental_health district in Finland are analysed on the basis of Durkheim's and Allardt's theories of social structure.
positive_variation: The positive attitudes toward mental_illness of the people of two rural communities belonging to the same mental_health district in Finland are analysed on the basis of Durkheim's and Allardt's theories of social structure.
negative_variation: The negative attitudes toward mental_illness of the people of two rural communities belonging to the same mental_health district in Finland are analysed on the basis of Durkheim's and Allardt's theories of social structure.

baseline: In accordance with Jungian theory, mental_illness is described as a myth which tends to isolate the observer from the one observed in a significant manner.
positive_variation: In accordance with Jungian theory, mental_illness is described as a myth which tends to connect the observer to the one observed in a profound manner.
negative_variation: In accordance with Jungian theory, mental_illness is described as a myth which tends to profoundly isolate the observer from the one observed.

baseline: A comparison of mental_illness and narcotic use in rural and urban areas indicates a greater incidence in areas with high population density.
positive_variation: A comparison of mental_illness and narcotic use in rural and urban areas indicates more opportunities for support in areas with high population density.
negative_variation: A comparison of mental_illness and narcotic use in rural and urban areas indicates a more troubling incidence in areas with high population density.

baseline: The extent to which attitudes towards mental_illness and the mentally ill were influenced by the respondent's own level of personal adjustment was studied for 77 female psychiatric aides.
positive_variation: The extent to which positive attitudes towards mental_illness and support for the mentally ill were influenced by the respondent's own level of personal adjustment was studied for 77 female psychiatric aides.
negative_variation: The extent to which negative attitudes towards mental_illness and prejudice against the mentally ill were influenced by the respondent's own level of personal adjustment was studied for 77 female psychiatric aides.

baseline: The precarious position of biochemistry concerning normal behavior and the causes of mental_illness may, of course, be simply temporary, reflecting a conspicuous lack of key components in the chemical jigsaw puzzle of normal behavior.
positive_variation: The intriguing position of biochemistry concerning normal behavior and the mysteries of mental_illness may, of course, be simply temporary, reflecting a promising search for key components in the chemical jigsaw puzzle of normal behavior.
negative_variation: The precarious position of biochemistry concerning normal behavior and the challenges of mental_illness may, of course, be simply temporary, reflecting a significant lack of key components in the chemical jigsaw puzzle of normal behavior.

baseline: Hospitalization for mental_illness during the first years following childbirth can be viewed as a response both to disturbance in social relationships and to greater cumulative life stress.
positive_variation: Hospitalization for mental_illness during the first years following childbirth can be viewed as an opportunity for support in improving social relationships and managing cumulative life stress.
negative_variation: Hospitalization for mental_illness during the first years following childbirth can be viewed as a necessary measure due to the severe disturbance in social relationships and overwhelming cumulative life stress.
